Lars Clausen writes:
[...]
> The problem arises when the arguments can be switched
> around or some arguments just change details of presentation.  Very
> difficult to deal with, not something that I'd recommend making a
> generic solution for.

You could extract and sort the arguments and do a comparison that way,
obviating the effect of reordering. The hard part is when certain
arguments are sometimes defaulted and sometimes not.
